comments.text:
Following is a phenomenon found by duplication test of bug 496723, with Tb 14.0.0 and Tb trunk 2012/7/18 build(17.0a1) Current phenomenon of bug 496723 is; When attribute is used in first/valid tag(i.e. != ), or when first/valid tag is omitted, any element before first string of including " in HTML comment" is ignored by Forward inline. HTML source:

message body text in html tag

Quoted text by Forward in inline: > ------- Original Message -------- > Subject: bug-496723, test-31, text/html mail, in HTML comments before first/valid tag > Date: Sun, 01 Jan 2012 01:02:03 +0000 > From: sender@example.com > To: receiver@example.com > > BBB --> > > message body text in html tag This phenomenon was observed with any of html5.parser.enable=true, html5.parser.enable=false, and html5.parser.enable is reset(not shown by Config Editor). Because text/html mail is used for test instead of multipart/alternative mail, problem was observed with any of View/Message Body As : Original HTML, Simple HTML, and Plain Text. It looks for me following phenomenon. (1) Any element before the in HTML comment is ignored. (2) "BBB --->" just after the in HTML comment is interpreted as body text. (3) HTML comments after the HTML comment with in it is correctly ignored. (4) Any element after the HTML comment with in it is correctly processed. Eeven though string of between AAA and BBB is merely an HTML comment text, Tb interprets it as if tag upon Forward inline. Above (1)/(3) looks for me a result by fixing of this bug's original problem, but problem of (2) still remains.
